name: Leroy Warriner
introduction: Leroy E. Warriner (March 1, 1919 - January 2, 2003) was an American racing driver who entered five Formula One races from 1951 to 1958, all Indianapolis 500s, but failed to qualify for any of these races. Warriner retired from racing in 1962, then owned the 15 mile (0.322 km) Indianapolis Speedrome oval track with Gene Hartley until 1977. An accomplished midget car racer, he was inducted into the National Midget Auto Racing Hall of Fame.
